title: Club Brugge 0-5 PSG: French champions on verge of qualification for last 16
text:
Kylian Mbappe came off the bench to grab a second half hat-trick and inspire Paris St Germain to a runaway 5-0 victory at Belgium's Club Brugge in the Champions League on Wednesday.

The win kept up their 100% record in Group A with the French team on nine points at the halfway mark and on the cusp of qualification for the next phase, a comfortable five points ahead of second placed Real Madrid.

Mauro Icardi put PSG into a seventh minute lead but it was only after World Cup winner Mbappe, working his way back after a hamstring injury, came on early in the second half that they clicked into gear.

Mauro Icardi put the visitors ahead in the seventh minute lead with a clinical strike

Icardi, on loan from Inter Milan, has scored in his last four appearances for the French side

MATCH FACTS Club Brugge: Mignolet, Mata, Mechele, Deli, Rits,Diatta, De Ketelaere (Okereke 57), Vanaken,Sobol (Balanta 80), Bonaventure (Openda 76), Tau. Subs Not Used: Kossounou, Sagna, Cools, Horvath. Booked: De Ketelaere, Rits. PSG: Navas, Meunier, Thiago Silva, Kimpembe, Bernat, Ander Herrera (Diallo 72), Marquinhos, Verratti, Di Maria, Icardi (Paredes 65), Choupo-Moting (Mbappe-Lottin 52). Subs Not Used: Cavani, Sergio Rico, Sarabia, Dagba. Booked: Choupo-Moting, Verratti, Meunier. Goals: Icardi 7, Mbappe 61,Icardi 63, Mbappe-Lottin 79, 83. Ref: Daniel Siebert (Berlin).

PSG's opener was simply done with a long ball over the top from skipper Thiago Silva to find Angel di Maria, who in turn slipped a square pass for his fellow Argentine to convert.

Mbappe came on shortly after halftime and within nine minutes had PSG further ahead.

His quick footwork set up Di Maria for a square pass that Brugge goalkeeper Simon Mignolet got a hand to, serving only to pop it up in the air for a quick-thinking Mbappe to head back over him and into the net.

Mbappe then set up the third for Icardi two minutes later after a defensive slip.

Di Maria was again the provider as Mbappe made it 4-0 in the 79th minute and then completed his hat-trick four minutes later.

On both occasions it was the pace of the 20-year-old in carving his way past the Brugge defence and his deft finishing that underlined his prowess.

Club Brugge have two points from their three group games and go to Paris for their next Champions League match on November 6.

Kylian Mbappe came off the bench to grab a second half hat-trick on Tuesday night

Icardi and Mbappe combined for the Frenchman to set up the third goal for the vistors
description: Mauro Icardi scored in his fourth successive game for Paris Saint-Germain as the French champions all but sealed their place in the last 16 of the Champions League.
